news.title: The Mary Wallopers at Victorious: Vampire Weekend, The Last Dinner Party, Cliffords voice support for Dundalk band after set was cut off
news.summary: The Last Dinner Party, The Academic and Cliffords pulled out of the festival, while Vampire Weekend condemned festival organisers during their headline set.

news.title: Vaticanjail - On Our Radar Q&A: "My music is for the girls, gays and theys, and the community that creates when they all join together"
news.summary: Electro-pop artist Vaticanjail discusses the translation between her Chilean and Irish roots in latest single ‘MIEL’

news.title: BBC explains why Hozier’s speech about Palestine at Reading and Leeds was not broadcast
news.summary: Hozier took to the stage at Reading Festival on August 22 and expressed his support for Palestine, free speech, KNEECAP and Palestine Action.

news.title: Melvin Benn: “To have two artists of their stature on the Friday night says a lot about Electric Picnic and how it’s become one of the big world festivals"
news.summary: Picnic chief Melvin Benn talks to Stuart Clark about new stages, the Stradbally acts he can’t wait to see, acts of political solidarity and the festival’s sustainability initiatives.

news.title: David Keenan announces New Single 'Poison Water'
news.summary: Find more information about the upcoming single below.

news.title: Kaiser Chiefs Live at the Docklands (Photos)
For Those I Love: "I knew I needed to take steps in a different direction. I just didn’t know what that direction was…"
news.summary: David Balfe's new album, Carving The Stone, is out now. He talks to Stuart Clark about Shelbourne FC and the marginalisation of working class communities.

news.title: 50 years ago today: Bruce Springsteen released Born To Run
news.summary: On this day 50 years ago, Bruce Springsteen released his third studio album, Born To Run. To celebrate, we're revisiting an interview with E Street Band saxophonist Clarence Clemons – who reflects on the creation of the classic album.
